title: La Puebla de Híjar
text:
La Puebla de Híjar is a town and municipality in the <a href="Bajo%20Mart%C3%ADn">Bajo Martín</a> comarca, <a href="Teruel%20%28province%29">Teruel province</a>, <a href="Arag%C3%B3n">Aragón</a>, Spain. It has a population of 1,046, an area of 61 km² and is located near <a href="N-232">N-232</a> road.
This town was the starting point of an abandoned railway line known as "Ferrocarril del Val de Zafán", to <a href="Alca%C3%B1iz">Alcañiz</a>, <a href="Tortosa">Tortosa</a> and eventually <a href="Sant%20Carles%20de%20la%20R%C3%A0pita">Sant Carles de la Ràpita</a>. Construction work began in 1891, but the last stretch between Tortosa and Sant Carles de la Ràpita was never completed before the line was abandoned.
Politics.
The <a href="mayor">mayor</a> of La Puebla de Híjar is Ms. Juana María Barreras, of the <a href="Spanish%20Socialist%20Workers%27%20Party">Partido Socialista Obrero Español</a>.
The <a href="Spanish%20Socialist%20Workers%27%20Party">Partido Socialista Obrero Español</a> has 5 <a href="councillor">councillor</a>s in the town's <a href="ayuntamiento">ayuntamiento</a>, <a href="United%20Left%20%28Spain%29">Izquierda Unida</a> has 2, and the <a href="People%27s%20Party%20%28Spain%29">Partido Popular</a> has 2.
In the 2004 Spanish <a href="General%20Election">General Election</a> the Partido Socialista Obrero Español got 46.0% of the vote in La Puebla de Híjar, the Partido Popular got 31.1%, Izquierda Unida got 12.5%, the <a href="Aragonese%20Council">Chunta Aragonesista</a>, 6.9% and the <a href="Aragonese%20Party">Partido Aragonés</a>, 2.7%.
